definition: to drown/to indulge/addicted to/to spoil (a child)
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: The drowning girl shouted for help.
sentences.chinese: 那個溺水的女孩子大聲呼救。

sentences.english: E. g. He sacrificed his life to save the drowning child.
sentences.chinese: 他犧牲自己的性命去拯救溺水的孩子。

sentences.english: He dived from the bridge and rescued the drowning child.
sentences.chinese: 他從橋上跳入水中，救起溺水的孩子。

sentences.english: I do hope no members drowned in your absence.
sentences.chinese: 希望別有會員在你離崗的時候溺水哈。

sentences.english: But as long as the swimmer is trying to save him or herself, then no one can save him or her.
sentences.chinese: 但只要溺水者還要自己救自己，那麼就沒人能救他。

sentences.english: Dry drowning is treated with a breathing tube being inserted into the lungs to supply oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 治療幹型溺水可在肺部插入呼吸管來供應氧氣。

sentences.english: Too white 63 years old drunk with wine be drowned but die, is to want to get moon not necessarily.
sentences.chinese: 太白六十三歲醉酒溺水而死，不一定是想撈月亮。

sentences.english: The lifeguard held the drowning man's head above water.
sentences.chinese: 救生員把溺水者的頭托出水面。

sentences.english: Age is one of the major risk factors for drowning.
sentences.chinese: 年齡是溺水的主要危險因素之一。

sentences.english: He periled his life to save the drowning boy.
sentences.chinese: 他冒險去救那個溺水的兒童。

sentences.english: Chan says extensive flooding may lead to loss of life from drowning and disease.
sentences.chinese: 陳指出過多的洪災將會導致人口因溺水或疾病死亡。

sentences.english: Males are especially at risk of drowning, with twice the overall mortality rate of females.
sentences.chinese: 男性溺水的危險特別大，溺水總死亡率爲女性的兩倍。

sentences.english: Males are especially at risk of drowning, with twice the overall mortality rate of females.
sentences.chinese: 男性溺水的危險特別大，溺水總死亡率爲女性的兩倍。

sentences.english: When a dog is drowning,every one offers him drink.
sentences.chinese: 待到狗溺水，衆人給水喝。

sentences.english: They are more likely to be hospitalized than females for non-fatal drowning.
sentences.chinese: 他們與女性相比，更有可能因非致命性溺水而住院。

sentences.english: The lifeguard saved the drowning girl at the risk of (losing) his life.
sentences.chinese: 這個救生員冒著生命的危險救起溺水的女孩。

definition: to fall into water/to sink/overboard/fig. to degenerate/to sink (into depravity)/to go to the dogs
to drown oneself by jumping into the river
to get into difficulties/to meet with danger
to lose one's footing/to slip/to take a wrong step in life
to fall off or jump off a building
